gui_classes module¶

class gui_classes.Board(window_location, width, height, squares=None)¶

Bases: object

The logical combination of displayable components to draw a board. Stores dimension data.

create_board_squares()¶

Generates a generic list of grey BoardSquare objects :return: A list of BoardSquare objects

create_col_labels()¶

Generates a list of TextBox objects to be the column labels :return: a list of TextBox objects

create_row_labels()¶

Generates a list of TextBox objects to be the row labels :return: a list of TextBox objects

class gui_classes.BoardSquare(grid_coord, window_coord, width, height, color=(122, 119, 111))¶

Bases: pygame.sprite.Sprite

Encapsulates the displayable idea of a board square with dimensional and color properties

update_color(color)¶

Updates the color of the board square :param color: an RGB value :return: void

class gui_classes.Player(ships, name)¶

Bases: object

Represents the encapsulation of ships, guesses, and name of a player

add_guess(coord)¶

Append a guess coordinate to the player’s guesses :param coord: The guess coordinate :return: void

class gui_classes.Ship(length, squareWidth, squareHeight, window_coord, orientation=0, color=(0, 0, 255))¶

Bases: pygame.sprite.Sprite

Encapsulates a displayable Ship object for the coord placement procedure.

class gui_classes.State(player1, player2)¶

Bases: object

Used in the main game loop to switch the current player. It stores the state of both players.

is_game_over()¶

Cross references the guesses versus the other player’s ships and checks whether the game is over. :return: boolean

update(guess)¶

Updates the state based by adding the guess and “flipping” the players. :param guess: a coordinate :return: void

class gui_classes.TextBox(message, window_coord=(0, 0), textcolor=(255, 255, 255), backgroundcolor=(0, 0, 0), fontsize=48, font=None)¶

Bases: pygame.sprite.Sprite

An encapsulation of a displayable text box with text
